title: Lyftâ€™s Revenue Jumps 70% as Higher Fares Offset Fewer Riders
sub_head: Ride-hailing company says Omicron surge will likely affect revenue growth in the first quarter
body:
Lyft Inc. said revenue increased 70% in the fourth quarter, as longer trips and higher fares offset weaker-than-expected ridership numbers.
The San Francisco-based company reported $969.9 million in revenue for the three months through December, beating the $941 million FactSet consensus.
